text:
- [Narrator] Advancements
in medical imaging
have the potential
to significantly improve patient outcomes.

They're also reshaping
radiologist workflows
with the help of AWS.
Today, radiologists are using AWS services
like AWS HealthImaging, Amazon Bedrock,
Amazon Transcribe Medical,

and Amazon SageMaker to
assist with day-to-day tasks,
and increase productivity.
Let's see how.

Much of a radiologist's
day is spent reviewing

and interpreting hundreds
of medical images.

When these images are
stored in HealthImaging,
they're available for review
with sub-second latency from anywhere.

HealthImaging allows
metadata and pixel data
to be accessed separately.
Here, we can see a medical image

loaded directly from
HealthImaging using OHIF,
an open-source DICOM viewer.
Instead of manually typing
their interpretation of the image,

which takes time, and
can introduce errors,

a radiologist can use an
ambient listening device
to dictate their interpretation.
Amazon Transcribe Medical
transcribes the dictation in real time.
The radiologist can review the transcript,
and make edits as needed.

Amazon Bedrock accepts
the final transcription
in an unstructured format,

and generates a structured
radiology report.

Let's see a demo of the
ambient reporting process
starting with transcription.
Patient is a 60-year-old male.
The chest X-ray shows low lung volumes

that accentuate the transverse
diameter of the heart
by bibasilar pacification,
consistent with pleural fluid
and underlying compressive atelectasis.

Pulmonary vascularity is
essentially within normal limits.
Now that we have the transcription,
we can generate a report with one click.

This improves accuracy,
reduces radiologist fatigue,
and saves valuable time.
(bright subtle music)

We've seen how radiologists
can become more productive

by dictating their observations
rather than typing.

Another time-intensive
task for radiologists
is reviewing historical imaging studies

to get a complete picture
of a patient's condition.

This is especially true
when the patient is elderly,
or has a long medical history.
Using Amazon Bedrock,
we can accurately generate trends

based on the patient's
past imaging reports
to create a longitudinal view
of their conditions in seconds.
Let's walk through a quick demo of this.

We start by uploading
a few radiology reports
and then click Submit to generate trends.

You can see that a number
of trends were generated,
including one that states

that there has been a
consistent decrease in the size

and FDG uptake of a
left axillary lymph node
from March 2018 to April 2019.
There is also a trend noted

that concerns the right
inguinal lymph node,
along with several others.

This functionality eliminates
the need for radiologists
to read multiple pages
of many long documents to fully understand

the patient's medical
history and conditions.
(bright subtle music)

So far, we've seen how
Amazon Transcribe Medical

and generative AI services
help radiologists save time
by creating reports from dictation

and generating trends based on
a patient's imaging history.

Radiologists also spend
significant time every day

interpreting images
and providing findings,
an average of five to 10 minutes per image
depending on the modality.

With the help of Amazon
SageMaker and Amazon Bedrock,
they can automatically generate
preliminary reports in seconds
that they can review and edit.

This reduces the amount of time
spent on interpreting images
and writing or dictating findings.

Let's see how quickly
we can generate a report
from an image itself,
in this case, an X-ray image.
The model can look at a series of studies

and generate a first
impression from the image
that the radiologist can review an edit.
We start by selecting an X-ray image,

or uploading one for
the model to interpret.

As you see, the model
generates first impressions

and findings from the image
that the radiologist can review
and change as needed.

This saves the time it
would otherwise take
to write the report themselves,

and opens the door to
greater productivity.
(bright subtle music)

Learn more about how AWS
empowers radiologists

and healthcare organizations
to unlock the power
of imaging data with AWS HealthImaging,
Amazon Bedrock and Amazon SageMaker.
(bright subtle music)
